name: grammar
reviewBody: Let me start by saying that I absolutely love this show... I hope it never ends. It is pure genius. I only wish Larry would stop saying "I could care less". This is a major faux pas for Larry. Improper use of phrases or words tends to irk Larry's character, but he has missed the boat on this one. The expression is 'I couldn't care less'. The message he is trying to convey is that he doesn't care at all, but by saying he 'could' care less, he is expressing the exact opposite of what he means to say. I'm aware that this is an often misused phrase, but if you really want to get your message across loud and clear, you say "I couldn't care less", meaning I don't care at all.
